_header: So thirled with the point of remembrance
Title(s): Compleynt of Anelida the quene upon fals Arcite
_description: ‘The Compleynt of Anelida the quene upon fals Arcite’, included in Chaucer’s Anelida and Arcite, but here occurring separately — twelve 9-line stanzas and two 16-line stanzas, including Proem and Conclusion

Bod638.First Lines: So thyrlid with the poynt of RemembraunceThe swerd of sorow I whet with fals plesavnce…
Bod638.Last Lines: …Now that Arcite Anelida to foreHath thirled with the poynt of remembraunce
Bod638.Attributed Title:
The complaynt of feyre Anelida on fals Arcyte (f. 5), Explicit So thirlid
                    with the poynte of Remembraunce (f. 7).
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.
Bod638.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             A Supplementary Parallel-Text Edition of Chaucer’s Minor
                Poems.
             2 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 22, 59. London: Trübner, n.d.; repr. New York and London:
            Johnson, 1967.

CULFf16.First Lines:
[s]O threlyd with þe poynt of Remembrauncethe swerd of sorowe
                    whet with fals plesaunceMyn herte bare of blysse & blacke of
                    heweThat turnyd ys to quakyng al my daunce…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…With yn þe temple with a sorowfull chereThat schapen was
                    as ye schal aftre here
CULFf16.Attributed Title:
Chaucer—His Complaint of Annelida (f. 61, in a post-medieval
                    hand)
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
So thirleth wyth the point of RemenbraunceThe swerd of sorow whet
                    with fals plesauns…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…As holden yow to make yow stedfasteAll myghthi god of trouth
                    souereyn
CamMagPep2006.Note:
Complaint, equivalent to lines 211-289 and 299-311 of Anelida and
                        Arcite.
CamMagPep2006.Attributed Title:
The Complaint of Anelida quene of Hermenye vpon false Arcite of Thebes (p.
                    382)
CamMagPep2006.Facsimiles:
Edwards,  A. S. G. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Pepys 2006: A Facsimile. Magdalen College,
                Cambridge.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and [Woodbridge, Suffolk]: Boydell and Brewer,
            1985.

CamTCC600.First Lines:
So thirlleþe with þe poynt of RemembraunceÞe swerd
                    of sorowe whett with fals plesaunce…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Howe þat Arcyte Anelyda so sooreHaþe thirlled with
                    þe point of Remembraunce
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Takeþe heed sirs I prey yowe of þis complaynt of Anelyda Qweene
                    of Cartage Roote of trouthe and stedfastnesse þat pytously Compleyneþe
                    vpon þe varyance of daun Arcyte lord borne of þe blood Royal of Thebes
                    englisshed by Geffrey Chaucier in þe best wyse and moost Rethoricyone
                    þe moost vnkouþe metre coloures and Rymes þat euer was sayde
                    tofore þis day redeþe and preveþe þe sooþe (p. 106);
                    þe compleynte of Anelyda (RT)

HunHM140.First Lines:
…So thirlith with the poynte of remembraunceThe Swerde of
                    sorowe y whett with fals plesaunce…
HunHM140.Last Lines:
…Howe that Arcite Anelida so soreHath ther led with the poynt
                    of remembraunce
HunHM140.Note:
Most of text on what were formerly two loose leaves, now ff. 85-86,
                    clearly intended to be here since 3845 runs over from 84v to 85 and
                    this text from 86v to 87; the complaint only, seventeen 8-line
                    stanzas, aaabaaab
HunHM140.Attributed Title:
Here endeth the compleynt of Anelida the Quene of hermenye vpon fals Arcite
                    of Thebees (f. 87)
HunHM140.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Odd Texts of the Minor Poems.
             2 vols. 
             Chaucer Society
         1st ser. 23, 60. London: Trübner, 1868, 1880; repr. New York and
            London: Johnson, 1967.
